Classical.Structure: A small endocrine gland in the epithalamus.
Classical.Function: Produces melatonin, modulating sleep patterns and seasonal cycles.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: A primary L1 quantum sensor. Contains cryptochromes that function as a 'Quantum Compass' via the Radical Pair Mechanism (RPM), allowing for direct sensing of the L6/L12 geomagnetic field. [cite_start]This quantum signal modulates melatonin output. [cite: 2280-2292, 3508-3512]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: The 'Seat of the Soul'. The antenna for transdimensional information, linking the physical brain to higher fields.

Falsification_Hypotheses: Melatonin production in pinealocytes will be unaffected by weak, oscillating magnetic fields in the microtesla range.
Knocking out cryptochrome genes in pinealocytes will not abolish their magnetic field sensitivity.
Experimental_Protocols: [cite_start]Test for S-T interconversion rates in pineal cryptochromes in response to 50 ÂµT magnetic fields. [cite: 2280-2292]
Measure melatonin output from pineal explants while applying weak RF fields known to disrupt the RPM.
